00011 #include "Jamoma.h"
00012 #include "SchedulerRamp.h"
00013 
00014 // called by the Max queue, and provided to the qelem -- needs to have a C interface
00015 void schedulerramp_clockfn(SchedulerRamp *x)
00016 {
00017         x->tick();
00018 }
00019 
00020 
00021 SchedulerRamp::SchedulerRamp(RampUnitCallback aCallbackMethod, void *aBaton)
00022         : RampUnit("ramp.scheduler", aCallbackMethod, aBaton), stepsize(0.0)
00023 {
00024         clock = clock_new(this, (method)&schedulerramp_clockfn);        // install the max timer
00025 
00026         registerAttribute(TT("granularity"), kTypeFloat32, &attrGranularity);   
00027         registerAttribute(TT("clock"), kTypeSymbol, &attrClock, (TTSetterMethod)&SchedulerRamp::setClock);      
00028 
00029         setAttributeValue(TT("granularity"), 20.0);
00030         setAttributeValue(TT("clock"), TT(""));
00031 }
00032 
00033 
00034 SchedulerRamp::~SchedulerRamp()
00035 {
00036         clock_unset(clock);
00037         object_free((t_object*)clock);
00038 }
00039 
00040 
00041 // TODO: setclock is deprecated in Max 5, so we may wish to remove this feature at some point?
00042 TTErr SchedulerRamp::setClock(const TTValue& newValue)
00043 {
00044         attrClock = newValue;
00045         //post("Tutten betutten");
00046         return kTTErrNone;
00047 }
00048 
00049 
00050 void SchedulerRamp::go(TTUInt32 inNumValues, TTFloat64 *inValues, TTFloat64 time)
00051 {
00052         short i;
00053         
00054         ramptime = time;
00055         numgrains = ramptime / attrGranularity;
00056         stepsize = 1.0 / numgrains;
00057 
00058         setNumValues(inNumValues);
00059         for(i=0; i<numValues; i++){
00060                 targetValue[i] = inValues[i];
00061                 startValue[i] = currentValue[i];
00062         }
00063         normalizedValue = 0.0;                          // set the ramp to the beginning
00064         setclock_fdelay(NULL, clock, 0);        // start now
00065 
00066 }
00067 
00068 
00069 void SchedulerRamp::stop()
00070 {
00071         clock_unset(clock);
00072 }
00073 
00074 
00075 void SchedulerRamp::tick()
00076 {
00077         short                   i;
00078         double                  mapped;
00079         double                  *current = currentValue;
00080         double                  *target = targetValue;
00081         double                  *start = startValue;
00082 
00083         // 1. go to the the next step in our ramp
00084         numgrains--;
00085         if(numgrains == 0){
00086                 for(i=0; i < numValues; i++)
00087                         currentValue[i] = targetValue[i];
00088         }
00089         else{
00090                 normalizedValue += stepsize;
00091                 mapped = functionUnit->map(normalizedValue);
00092                 for(i=0; i < numValues; i++)
00093                         current[i] = start[i] + ((target[i] - start[i]) * mapped);
00094         }
00095         
00096         // 2. send the value to the host
00097         (callback)(baton, numValues, currentValue);
00098 
00099         // 3. set the clock to fire again
00100         if(numgrains)
00101                 setclock_fdelay(NULL, clock, attrGranularity);
00102 
00103 }
